pr_title: ILM: don't take snapshot of a data stream's write index

timeline.message:
ILM: don't take snapshot of a data stream's write index

We don't allow converting a data stream's writeable index into a searchable
snapshot. We are currently preventing swapping a data stream's write index
with the restored index.

This adds another step that will not proceed with the searchable snapshot action
until the managed index is not the write index of a data stream anymore.

timeline.bodyText:
I think calling it "stopping" might be a little confusing, I would suggest something like:
"index [.ds-foo-0001] is the write index for data stream [foo], pausing ILM execution until this index is no longer the write index for the data stream via manual or automated rollover"
What do you think?
